result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Scheduling Order;  signed on 10-20-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III

Case called at 9:30 a.m.
Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Angela Wang in court for Deangelo L Carter.   
Defendant Deangelo L Carter appeared by video.
Attorney Wang requests that the case be placed on the trial calendar.
Jury status hearing scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 14, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 14, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on February 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 10:06 a.m.
Intern Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Angela Wang in court for Deangelo L Carter.  
Defendant Deangelo L Carter not in court.
State requests that a Capias be issued and bail be revoked and forfeited.
Court will issue a Capias.
Bail is to be revoked and forfeited.
Defense requests that the Capias be STAYED.
Court will issue a Capias, but STAY it until the next court date.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deangelo L Carter in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Deangelo L Carter.  Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department Detective Christopher  Bellows sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Szczupakiewicz.  Cross examination by Attorney Wang.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Wang objects to bind over without argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
proposed Motion and Order to Seal Victim Identification Key;  filed by the State
confirmed receipt of positive test filed by Atty Wang
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:18 AM Attorney Angela Wang in court.   Defendant Deangelo L Carter did not appear.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wang states the defendant contacted her that he is ill today and she has requested documentation from the defendant in regards to this.  Attorney Szczupakiewicz does not take a position and indicates there is currently a referral that additional charges will be filed.  The Court requests defense submit a letter to the Court verifying there is information the defendant is currently ill.  The Court will adjourn until next week for a preliminary hearing and time limits previously waived.  Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
filed by the State
